p: The fatty acid profile of pork directly reflects the FA profile of the pig diet [ 8]. Vegetable oils such as soybean or rapeseed oil contain high levels of UFAs and may lead to healthier products for consumers [ 9]. On the other hand, the incorporation of PUFAs into the diet is restricted by the resulting decrease in lipid oxidative stability [ 10], which influences taste, flavour, colour [ 11], and shelf life [ 12]. Moreover, feed with a high level of vegetable oil that is rich in UFAs affects the fat consistency (soft and sticky), and thus decreases the quality of meat products [ 13].
